column5: We are going to be at Rex toltons milesbay camp August 8th.
Been there, nice folks. They still have the narrow boat ramp approach with a tree strategically spaced on each side? I liked the assigned dock space, you always knew where to dock. Bill
Yep, the trees still defend the boat ramp!Frank
Staying near sabaskong bay lodge was wondering how far of a boat trip is it to Miles Bay ?is the fishing generally better the more north you go. This will be my first trip to LOW . Thx
It's 12 miles or so from gills marina in morson to grassy narrows lodge in milesbay.
It is buoyed all the way so you can run. Doesn't take long unless the weather kicks up.
Looking at an 8-9 mile boat ride. Not a big deal!

I fish in Sabaskong Bay for all species and do quite well. I have never had to go as far as Miles Bay to catch walleyes. I actually catch all the walleyes I want in a two mile circle around the lodge I stay at.Frank
Thanks for all the replies, I'm really looking forward to this trip. I haven't fished a new to me body of water in nw ontario in 15 years.
When are you going to be there?
Breez - Do you mind sharing the name of the lodge you stay at? Thanks, Bill
Red Wing - been going there for about 25 yearsFrank

Last week of July. My uncle owns a cabin/island north of sabaskong bay lodge. I've been fishing nw ontario since 1985 and never been there. My older brothers went a lot in the early eighties with my dad, but when I came of age we started fishing further north in ontario. Super excited to fish new water
